definition: sb who is always hungry/glutton/(Buddhism) hungry ghost
ghost/demon/terrible/damnable/clever/sly/crafty/(suffix for sb with a certain vice or addiction etc)/one of the 28 constellations

sentences.english: The Buttah are normally associated with nightmares, abductions and the taking of small children.
sentences.chinese: 餓鬼通過與惡夢在一起，誘拐和吸引小孩。

sentences.english: Having talked about hungry ghosts, we'll talk about hell-beings next.
sentences.chinese: 談過了餓鬼，接下來我們來談談地獄衆生。

sentences.english: We offer food and wine to the famished ghosts that come up to earth from hell.
sentences.chinese: 我們供食物和酒給那些從地府來到人間的餓鬼。

sentences.english: Marius ate like an ogre. He gave the waiter six sous.
sentences.chinese: 馬呂斯象餓鬼似的吃了一頓，給了堂倌六個蘇。

definition: to transmit Buddhist teaching/chakram or chakka (throwing disk)
to convert to (a religion)/to rely upon/refuge/mainstay
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
to abandon suffering and obtain happiness (Buddhism)
